website_summaries.verdict: This easy-to-assemble dome tent features 2 fiberglass poles and outer layer. Lightweight and ideal for summer use.
pros: Easily set this tent up with the 2 fiberglass pole system, then stake the outer layer down
2-peak roof keeps you dry in the rain
Spacious for 3 people at 7' by 7' feet for a total of 49 square feet of space
Packs down easily into provided bag
cons: You may want to replace the supplied tent stakes with more durable ones

customer_reviews.title: Might be OK for Summer Camping
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad tent and the price was very reasonable. It was also easy to set up. The top of the tent is basically a screen mesh (not solid fabric) with a rain cover attachment. Therefore no heat will stay in the tent and any outside wind or draft will blow directly through the tent. Not the best situation for anything other than warm summer nights. I'd like to do some spring and fall camping and this thing might keep me dry but it's basically like sleeping out in the elements. I should have spent a few more bucks and got something that I could really use!!
customer_reviews.author: Frank Costello

customer_reviews.title: Good little tent
customer_reviews.text: Good little tent. I used it in a 24 hour running event and got caught in a heavy downpour for the entire night. Not one leak and the tent held up fairly well during strong wind gusts (a little flexing in the poles, but no worries of the stakes coming loose or poles breaking). This is a great tent for the money. I would say it really is best suited for one person and gear. If you are over 6' tall, it will be a tight fit.
customer_reviews.author: JENNIFER DUKES

customer_reviews.title: Good tent for the money, rainfly sucks in wind
customer_reviews.text: The tent itself is fine for the money you're spending. The rain fly design is absolutely useless if there is any wind whatsoever. The way it hangs over the front and back doors creates so much lift that you need massive stakes to keep it nailed down to the ground. I did like the fact it has two doors and the tent was really easy to set up and take down.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive back up tent
customer_reviews.text: For the price and the situation I needed it for it was sufficient for the job. I needed a quick and inexpensive tent for my son and I to use while we volunteered in Florida forhurricane Matthew cleanup efforts. Tent Went up easily and dried out quick. This is definitely a summer tent. I would not recommend it for late summer or fall camping when the temperatures get below 40°
customer_reviews.author: sjamiso

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on 30 degrees night with a bit of rain
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on 30 degrees night with a bit of rain. The rain fly took two people to attach as the center pole kept slipping out. I did purchase the GEERTOP Waterproof Adjustable Tent Compression bag because the bag that came with the tent is WAY too small for it to fit back in. Overall I do recommend it as it is made well and did a great job in the rain and cold.
customer_reviews.author: Laura S. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Holds up pretty well in heavy rain but you will get some ...
customer_reviews.text: Holds up pretty well in heavy rain but you will get some water coming into the tent because the fly does not cover the sides 100% where the bathtub seam meets the normal tent fabric. Light rain just fine. An additional tarp and or tent seal will solve these problems. Its hard to do much better in the $50 price range.
customer_reviews.author: Scientist69

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice, waterproof, well designed. Don't be too tall though
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Waterproof plastic base, excellent tent design, quick setup and teardown, packs up tiny and light. Cons: Only fits 2 people due to low ceiling and strongly curved walls that make it a tight fit to lie down in. Minor point but I already managed to bend one tent peg, which may be my fault or due to cheap pegs, but there are no spares.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: good construction, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get down and measure it to confirm 7x7, but I used this as a personal sleeper for a camping trip and it would be a stretch to get 3 people in this thing, especially if anyone is heavy or over 6 feet tall. The bathtub design for the canvas bottom helped keep some moisture out but with a filled tent in a moist environment (even just morning dew) would absolutely result in some interior wetness through contact with the walls. That said, good construction, easy setup, and great price.
customer_reviews.author: Russell I.

customer_reviews.title: This is a good one
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent went on a 3 day camping and its good quality this particular size is small i would recommend for one person but If you’re backpacking two people fit fine in it too, husband and used it we put a queen mattress inside but ended up with just enough space for our gear. Good quality held up very well during all 3 days. The zippers are good double zippers, mesh leaves all the bugs behind, over all good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Damita

customer_reviews.title: Handy Little Tent
customer_reviews.text: Tent is somewhat toy-like. However, it has a durable floor and packs small. Used in Colorado for three nights of clear sky and light wind. I'm not sure how it would have fared in a storm, but worked well under easy conditions. I bought it for the price and that it has the largest rain fly of any model I could find in that price range.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up, fit 2 and a child well. Have not used in rain. Would probably use tarp under if I did expect it. The steaks are a bit flimsy. Has a hook top inside or light/lantern. And a mesh pocket on one inside wall. Easy to put away light wait, takes up very little space when put away.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree

customer_reviews.title: winner!
customer_reviews.text: 8 days car camping, Solid tent, great openings, excellent setup, tons of room for one person. Every bit as good as an REI tent, great ventilation options.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend better tent stacks
customer_reviews.text: Just slept 4 nights in this tent. It rained one night but I had a trap over it so can't say how well the fly works. The zippers seem cheap but held up to the in and out. I would recommend better tent stacks, the ones that come with the tent are flimsy and we bent one.
customer_reviews.author: beekeeper

customer_reviews.title: Good 3 season tent
customer_reviews.text: Easy set-up, decent construction, and good amount of space for two. The material is very lightweight, so I doubt it would be very comfortable when temps fall into the 30/40 range but it works well for what it is. As noted in other reviews, the stakes are a joke but this tent is great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Samson

customer_reviews.title: used this for camping in the Netherlands. It rained ...
customer_reviews.text: used this for camping in the Netherlands. It rained REALLY HARD sporadically over 4 days. I would say for the amount of rain that poured down I am surprised more water didn't make it into the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Great little tent that holds up in bad weather!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and kept me warm and dry on a cold windy October camping trip. Perfect for one person and gear. Two people could easily fit but 3 would be a bit cozy for comfort! Nice quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Marie N.

customer_reviews.title: Everything worked as advertised and the tent fit 3 people (one being a rather small person) comfortably (albeit drunk at the tim
customer_reviews.text: Set up 1st time with barely glancing at the instructions. Everything worked as advertised and the tent fit 3 people (one being a rather small person) comfortably (albeit drunk at the time.) Would recommend as an inexpensive solution to camping needs!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: A good tent at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: For the money, a good tent. Went up easily and quickly, came down just the same, but the usual caveat applies: Bring along your own tent stakes. The ones provided are horribly flimsy!
customer_reviews.author: Cathryn Troise

customer_reviews.title: I love this tent I want to start by saying my ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent I want to start by saying my life demanded a bigger tent, I had a 2 person and it was being used for two people and 3 dogs. I have only used this tent for three nights at a time while base camping and my only complaints are the quality of the stitching on the stuff sack and the color. It is pictures as a deep green colors and showed up sea foam and looks very girly. But the set up is quick and easy the bathtub bottom style really cuts down the damp mornings and the venitilation is great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Eeb

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tent for a Cub Scout Campout. It was very easy to set up. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi T.

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Great tent for the money! The double doors is a cool concept. Assembling the tent isn't too hard at all and the poles are sturdy. As always better tent stakes could be in order, but that's what you have to expect when you buy an inexpensive tent, but it doesn't make it a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Peter H

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tent!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, can't beat it. Has everything my buddy's Coleman has AND more. Love that the rain cover helps block wind too, unlike the Coleman.
customer_reviews.author: Sizzlinninja

customer_reviews.title: He had no problem assembling it and it's perfect for what he needs
customer_reviews.text: got this for my son's cub scout camping trip. He had no problem assembling it and it's perfect for what he needs.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny B.

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 3 day camping trip. It help up wonderfully in terrible thunderstorms. I would repurchase due to the low price and the decent quality of the tent.
customer_reviews.author: PsychologyPro

customer_reviews.title: Very cool and easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I just got this and set it up in my living room. Very cool and easy set up. Well designed. Anticipate no problems in the "wild". Great price! Weighs in around 7 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Mackintosh

customer_reviews.title: This is a good buy, go for it!
customer_reviews.text: Sets up in minutes, very roomy inside (two twin air mattresses can fit side by side inside) and it seems to be of high quality. I'll be using this forever.
customer_reviews.author: EG

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: We still tent camp and this tent replaced one of ours that wore out after years of use. The tent set up was quick and easy, and bottom of the tent did a great job keeping moisture out. Three children slept comfortably in the tent - for adults it's a 2-person tent. Having the rain fly incorporated makes set up that much easier. We're looking forward to using this tent for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: LindyLouTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Solid tent for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up and kept the rain out with no leaks! a few friends had a Coleman that leaked and I stayed dry. vents on both sides are nice as well.
customer_reviews.author: S.D.Willie

customer_reviews.title: ... tents for our Boy Scout Troop and they worked great at our last camp out
customer_reviews.text: We bought 10 tents for our Boy Scout Troop and they worked great at our last camp out. Easy for boys to set up and plenty of room to sleep and store gear.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C. Welborn

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and disassembly. Have not used in rain or colder weather so nothing to add.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Lake Tahoe
customer_reviews.text: Easy set-up, enough room for a queen air matress (and about 6 inches for storing clothes/items). Warm in 55 degree nights.
customer_reviews.author: mariposazul

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for son's "first" camping trip. Kept him dry! Fit 2 people + gear, no problem!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy to set up and take down. Exactly what we were looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Megntally

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the Buck
customer_reviews.text: For the price this tent is great. One adult can set it up, including the rain fly, in under 5 minutes. Comes with everything you need. I plan on using this for BS of A camp-outs and beach trips. You probably won't be able to compress it small enough to get it back into the bag, however. This isn't a complaint really, just a heads up.
customer_reviews.author: E-Rock

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than Expected
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I thought it would be. Good for two preteens or one adult with camping supplies. Very well constructed and easy to assemble at a camp site.
customer_reviews.author: KLR

customer_reviews.title: easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: on time. easy to set up. room for 2 and gear . easy to repack. have yet to use in rain.fair price.
customer_reviews.author: W. Satterley

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, exceptional value
customer_reviews.text: Awesome quality for the price, my wife and I were pleasantly surprised. Would definitely recommend. I'm 6'2" my wife is 5'10" and we did not feel cramped as we had expected. Kept us dry through a light rain, although you will want to have a tarp set up between two trees or something as an extra shield if you expect much horizontal rain.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Fritzemeier

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Poles strong. Fairly easy to put together (with a partner; alone I think it might be a bit harder). It rained several times during our first camping trip with it, and we plus our gear stayed dry as a bone. Very roomy for two people. We had plenty of room for two sleeping adults, our packs, shoes, etc. We even fit four people inside to play cards during the rain (the other two campers' tent flooded out, so they had to take shelter in ours until the storm passed). Anyway, long story short, I highly recommend this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Brown

customer_reviews.title: Small, but good in the rain
customer_reviews.text: It says for 3, but only if you're very friendly. My wife and I are both short, but it was a cozy fit. That being said, we were in a pouring rain at Newport, Oregon with our daughter's family. They had the extra tarp to cover their tent (our grandson was in the other tent) and we had the rain fly and nothing more. About midnight our daughter tossed our grandson into our dry tent and she and her husband slept in the van. We stayed warm and dry all night in spite of a driving rain all night.
customer_reviews.author: Frederic J Byers

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup within minutes
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of space for me an a buddy. Even survived a thunderstorm! Easy setup within minutes!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan0303

customer_reviews.title: easy to set up alone
customer_reviews.text: easy to set up alone, rain didn't get in, fit a full sized blow up mattress with extra space. would not recommend for very cold weather under 40-45
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jemm Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Good for 2 .. Color is off
customer_reviews.text: The bad: Color not green, its like.. faded ice burg lettuce green. not what i was expecting. This is not a 3 adult person tent, assuming average height and weight. The good: Came on time, all pieces included in package, and most of all the price. I'll use this tent maybe 2 or three times a year. Over all, once consumer to another, if thats what you're looking for then meh, pretty ok.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: This is more a 2-person tent
customer_reviews.text: Can't have high quality expectations for the price we paid for this tent, but my only complaint was that this was not a 3-person tent. I'm tiny (5' ft tall) and my bf is average (6' ft tall). This tent was snug enough for the both of us, plus a couple 10L backpacks. I don't think it would have been comfortable if we had another full sized person bunked with us.
customer_reviews.author: kgeslani

customer_reviews.title: Well it is a great tent, nice ventilation but will also keep out ...
customer_reviews.text: Well it is a great tent, nice ventilation but will also keep out the rain. Have used it once and it handled a light storm. I would have gave it 5 stars but I believe the three person claim is a bit exaggerated. It is awesome for two people that's why I purchased it. You could sleep three in a pinch however
customer_reviews.author: frymonkey

customer_reviews.title: Nice size and very light so it should be PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: cant wait to try this backpacking. Nice size and very light so it should be PERFECT! thanks
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Bloom

customer_reviews.title: Have used this tent for every trip for two years ...
customer_reviews.text: Have used this tent for every trip for two years. It has stood up to rain, heavy wind, cold times and hot times. This one is a winner and the price cant be beat!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: To the point: It arrived with the elastic string ...
customer_reviews.text: To the point: It arrived with the elastic string that runs through and holds the poles together broken. The fabric is a little thinner than other tents I have owned, I will have to see if it holds up while camping. Returning it is not worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: 1stimemomma

product_meta.title: Stansport McKinley Camping Dome Tent, 3-Person
product_meta.description: McKinley' 3 Season Tent with 2 large doors for easy access, 2-peak roof helps keep you dry in wet conditions, Large mesh panels for maximum ventilation, Fully taped and sealed rain fly, Bathtub floor design to help keep moisture out, Shock corded poles for easy set up, Stuff bag included, Sleeps 3 people, 7' x 7' x 54 High.
feature_bullets: Made in the USA or Imported
Size: 7' X 7' X 54", Sleeps 3 persons, Weighs 8lbs. 7 oz., Floor area 49 sq. ft.
2 large doors for easy access, large mesh panels for maximum ventilation
2 peak roof helps keep you dry in wet conditions, Fully taped and sealed rain fly
Bath tub floor design to help keep moisture out, Shock corded poles for easy set up and take down
Stuff bag included for storage and transportation

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
